[rack]
  driver = usbhid-ups
  port = auto
  pollinterval = 15
  desc = Rack UPS
Welcome to VaultHunters gaymers! Powered by Serpie's Service Stack.

/hr/k8s-at-home.com-charts-node-feature-.title: node-feature-discovery helm release
/hr/k8s-at-home.com-charts-node-feature-.name: node-feature-discovery
/hr/k8s-at-home.com-charts-node-feature-.doc:
Node Feature Discovery is a Kubernetes add-on that helps automate the discovery and configuration of node features such as CPU, memory, and network interfaces.

Most people in k8s at home use Node Feature Discovery to ensure that pods that need video transcoding capabilities are running on a node with an Intel GPU (which has excellent video transcoding capabilities). But also for detecting a Zigbee/Z-Wave USB sticks.

For example, the following code would guarantee that a node will run on a Node with Intel GPU:

affinity:
  nodeAffinity:
    requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
      nodeSelectorTerms:
        - matchExpressions:
          - key: feature.node.kubernetes.io/custom-intel-gpu
            operator: In
            values:
              - "true"

Node Feature Discovery, would figure out a node has an Intel GPU and add the feature.node.kubernetes.io/custom-intel-gpu: true label.

0:
- name: TZ
  value: "${TIMEZONE}"
- name: JAVA_OPTS_APPEND
  value: "-Djgroups.dns.query=keycloak-headless"
- name: KC_PROXY
  value: edge
- name: KC_HTTP_ENABLED
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME
  value: id.${DOMAIN_1}
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT_HTTPS
  value: "true"
- name: KC_LOG_LEVEL
  value: "org.keycloak.events:DEBUG,org.infinispan:INFO,org.jgroups:INFO"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_USER}"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASS}"

# - name: QUARKUS_TRANSACTION_MANAGER_ENABLE_RECOVERY
#   value: "true"
# - name: KC_CACHE_STACK
#   value: kubernetes
# - name: KC_DB_USERNAME
#   value: "${POSTGRES_SSO_USERNAME}"
# - name: KC_DB_PASSWORD
#   value: "${POSTGRES_SSO_PASSWORD}"

#   value: postgres
# - name: KC_DB_URL_HOST
#   value: "postgresql.sso.svc.cluster.local"
# - name: KC_DB_URL_PORT

#   value: sso
# - name: KC_CACHE
#   value: ispn

#   value: /auth
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/tls.crt
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_KEY_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/tls.key
# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/truststore.jks
# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_PASSWORD
#   value: password
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CLIENT_AUTH
#   value: request

# Could use the above envar, but lets use the quarkus conf file
quarkus.transaction-manager.enable-recovery=true
# quarkus.http.non-application-root-path=/

- name: objectstore
  emptyDir:
    sizeLimit: 100Mi
- name: quarkusproperties
  secret:
    secretName: keycloak-quarkusproperties
    defaultMode: 0777

- mountPath: /ObjectStore
  name: objectstore
- name: quarkusproperties
  mountPath: /opt/keycloak/conf/quarkus.properties
  subPath: quarkus.properties
